issue.title: Fix race condtion when mutliple local endpoints are created
issue.body:
There is a race condition when the worker nodes get restarted one by one. More than one submariner endpoint is created in one cluster as two gateways tries to be the leader. One yields later and this triggers a endpoint delete event. This causes routes to be cleared in both local and remote cluster. Later an endpoint update even comes for the active gateway, and we are using the update event in the fix

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our developer guide: https://submariner.io/development/
2. Ensure you have added the appropriate tests for your PR: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#test-new-functionality
3. Read the code review guide to ease the review process: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/
4. If the PR is unfinished, mark it as a draft: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#mark-work-in-progress-prs-as-drafts
5. If you are using CI to debug, use your private fork: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#use-private-forks-for-debugging-prs-by-running-ci
6. Add labels to the PR as appropriate.

This template is based on the K8s/K8s template:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md
-->

comment.body:
>That’s odd. After leader election was lost it should’ve exited quickly but did not for 7 sec. And it should not have recreated the EP.

Right, this is exactly what was happening. 

> It does a create or update operation but we just want update in this case.

AFAIR, we were getting update event itself for the endpoint?

commits.message:
Fix new linting errors

Newer versions of goconst detect more instances of string duplication so
introduce constants.

Also fixed :

"indent-error-flow: if block ends with a return statement, so drop this else
and outdent its block (move short variable declaration to its own line if
necessary) (revive)"

Signed-off-by: Tom Pantelis <tompantelis@gmail.com>

Fix lint error in wireguard

pkg/cable/wireguard/getconnections.go:66:57: directive `//nolint:gosec // ...`
  is unused for linter "gosec" (nolintlint)
    if k, err := keyFromSpec(&con.Endpoint); err == nil { //nolint:gosec...

Signed-off-by: Tom Pantelis <tompantelis@gmail.com>

Remove release-notes files

We're no longer checking in such files to the projects, also once the
notes were merged into the web-site doc, the files no longer serve any
purpose.

Signed-off-by: Tom Pantelis <tompantelis@gmail.com>

Merge branch 'devel' into gw_leader_election

Signed-off-by: Janki Chhatbar <jchhatba@redhat.com>

issue.title: Fix race condtion when mutliple local endpoints are created
issue.body:
There is a race condition when the worker nodes get restarted one by one. More than one submariner endpoint is created in one cluster as two gateways tries to be the leader. One yields later and this triggers a endpoint delete event. This causes routes to be cleared in both local and remote cluster. Later an endpoint update even comes for the active gateway, and we are using the update event in the fix

comment.body:
This is related to https://issues.redhat.com/browse/ACM-8274. There were 3 gateways on cluster 2. `gateway-f6pm7 `got the leader lock first, created EP 10.1.114.75 and then lost the lock:

```
I1017 13:00:12.587547    1 leaderelection.go:255] successfully acquired lease submariner-operator/submariner-gateway-lock
E1017 13:00:26.130636    1 leaderelection.go:327] error retrieving resource lock submariner-operator/submariner-gateway-lock: Get “[https://172.30.0.1:443/apis/coordination.k8s.io/v1/namespaces/submariner-operator/leases/submariner-gateway-lock](https://172.30.0.1/apis/coordination.k8s.io/v1/namespaces/submariner-operator/leases/submariner-gateway-lock)”: context deadline exceeded
```

Then gateway-8647c got the leader lock and deleted EP 10.1.114.75 and created EP 10.1.114.99:

```
I1017 13:00:30.961641    1 leaderelection.go:255] successfully acquired lease submariner-operator/submariner-gateway-lock
[90m2023-10-17T13:00:31.292Z[0m [32mINF[0m ../datastoresyncer.go:265 DSSyncer             Successfully deleted existing submariner Endpoint “dnd-prsurve-dev-2-submariner-cable-dnd-prsurve-dev-2-10-1-114-75”
[90m2023-10-17T13:00:31.311Z[0m [32mINF[0m ../datastoresyncer.go:329 DSSyncer             Creating local submariner Endpoint: types.SubmarinerEndpoint{Spec:v1.EndpointSpec{ClusterID:“dnd-prsurve-dev-2", CableName:“submariner-cable-dnd-prsurve-dev-2-10-1-114-99”, HealthCheckIP:“”, Hostname:“compute-1”, Subnets:[]string{“242.1.0.0/16"}, PrivateIP:“10.1.114.99”, PublicIP:“66.187.232.130", NATEnabled:false, Backend:“libreswan”, BackendConfig:map[string]string{“natt-discovery-port”:“4490”, “preferred-server”:“false”, “udp-port”:“4500”}}}

```

But then `gateway-f6pm7` recreated EP 10.1.114.75 after it lost leadership and before it exited:

```
[90m2023-10-17T13:00:32.610Z[0m [32mINF[0m ../datastoresyncer.go:329 DSSyncer             Creating local submariner Endpoint: types.SubmarinerEndpoint{Spec:v1.EndpointSpec{ClusterID:“dnd-prsurve-dev-2”, CableName:“submariner-cable-dnd-prsurve-dev-2-10-1-114-75", HealthCheckIP:“242.1.255.254”, Hostname:“compute-2", Subnets:[]string{“242.1.0.0/16”}, PrivateIP:“10.1.114.75", PublicIP:“66.187.232.130”, NATEnabled:false, Backend:“libreswan”, BackendConfig:map[string]string{“natt-discovery-port”:“4490", “preferred-server”:“false”, “udp-port”:“4500"}}}
[9:38](https://redhat-internal.slack.com/archives/D052PTTFS0P/p1698370689903849)
[90m2023-10-17T13:00:33.054Z[0m [1m[31mFTL[0m[0m ..al/pkg/log/logger.go:67 main                 Leader election lost, shutting down
```

That’s odd. After leader election was lost it should’ve exited quickly but did not for 7 sec. And it should not have recreated the EP.

issue.title: Fix race condtion when mutliple local endpoints are created
issue.body:
There is a race condition when the worker nodes get restarted one by one. More than one submariner endpoint is created in one cluster as two gateways tries to be the leader. One yields later and this triggers a endpoint delete event. This causes routes to be cleared in both local and remote cluster. Later an endpoint update even comes for the active gateway, and we are using the update event in the fix

comment.body:
I see where cluster "dnd-prsurve-dev-1" acquired the leader lock

` I1017 10:23:08.731886       1 leaderelection.go:255] successfully acquired lease submariner-operator/submariner-gateway-lock`

But it didn't lose the lock, at least not in that log snippet. How many gateways were configured on cluster "dnd-prsurve-dev-1"?

issue.title: Fix race condtion when mutliple local endpoints are created
issue.body:
There is a race condition when the worker nodes get restarted one by one. More than one submariner endpoint is created in one cluster as two gateways tries to be the leader. One yields later and this triggers a endpoint delete event. This causes routes to be cleared in both local and remote cluster. Later an endpoint update even comes for the active gateway, and we are using the update event in the fix

comment.body:
> > When nodes are restarted, there are disruption in api server connection and during this time, two leaders are present simultaneously and two local endpoints are created. Later one of them yields as it is not able to get the gateway lock.
> 
> Are you saying that there are 2 local endpoints present in the cluster at the same time? When the gateway acquires the leader lock, it first deletes any other endpoints before creating its own. Also it doesn't delete its endpoint if it loses the leader lock and/or exits. I'm trying to see a scenario where 2 local endpoints coexist simultaneously. The whole point of using leader election is to prevent 2 gateway controllers from running critical code simultaneously. If there's a hole in this process then I think we need to understand this. I'm wary of just trying to "band-aid" it in the route-agent.
> 
> If the API server isn't available then it shouldn't be able to acquire the leader lock nor create endpoints as those operations require access to the API server.
> 
> What could happen is if the first gateway acquires the lock and creates an endpoint then later loses connection to the API server and can't renew the lock after 5 sec (`RenewDeadline`) and exits. Then the second gateway acquires the lock after 10 sec (`LeaseDuration`) and creates another endpoint. But this is a fail-over scenario, ie there's aren't 2 leaders present simultaneously.
> 
> Can you provide a detailed step-by-step sequence of the scenario and any log messages?

This is the log from node where gateway got elected and later yielded 
`[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.621Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..-source/app/main.go:429 main                 Using namespace "submariner-operator" for the leader election lock
I1017 10:23:08.621704       1 leaderelection.go:245] attempting to acquire leader lease submariner-operator/submariner-gateway-lock...
I1017 10:23:08.731886       1 leaderelection.go:255] successfully acquired lease submariner-operator/submariner-gateway-lock

[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.732Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..reswan/libreswan.go:127 libreswan            Using NATT UDP port 4500
[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.732Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..gine/cableengine.go:104 CableEngine          CableEngine controller started, driver: "libreswan"
[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.732Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..public_ip_watcher.go:62 Endpoint             Starting the public IP watcher.
[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.732Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..r/datastoresyncer.go:73 DSSyncer             Starting the datastore syncer
[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.733Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..ers/tunnel/tunnel.go:40 Tunnel               Starting the tunnel controller
[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.834Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..er/healthchecker.go:110 HealthChecker        CableEngine HealthChecker started with PingInterval: 1, MaxPacketLossCount: 5
[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.835Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..thchecker/pinger.go:106 HealthChecker        Starting pinger for IP "242.1.255.254"
[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.835Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..er/healthchecker.go:159 HealthChecker        CableEngine HealthChecker started pinger for CableName: "submariner-cable-dnd-prsurve-dev-2-10-1-114-105" with HealthCheckIP "242.1.255.254"
[90m2023-10-17T10:23:08.863Z[0m [32mINF[0m ..ery/natdiscovery.go:162 NAT                  Starting NAT discovery for endpoint "submariner-cable-dnd-prsurve-dev-2-10-1-114-105"

repo.name: submariner
repo.description: Connect all your Kubernetes clusters, no matter where they are in the world.

repo.name: submariner
repo.description: Networking component for interconnecting Pods and Services across Kubernetes clusters.

issue.title: Fix race condtion when mutliple local endpoints are created
issue.body:
There is a race condition when the worker nodes get restarted one by one. More than one submariner endpoint is created in one cluster as two gateways tries to be the leader. One yields later and this triggers a endpoint delete event. This causes routes to be cleared in both local and remote cluster. Later an endpoint update even comes for the active gateway, and we are using the update event in the fix

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our developer guide: https://submariner.io/development/
2. Ensure you have added the appropriate tests for your PR: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#test-new-functionality
3. Read the code review guide to ease the review process: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/
4. If the PR is unfinished, mark it as a draft: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#mark-work-in-progress-prs-as-drafts
5. If you are using CI to debug, use your private fork: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#use-private-forks-for-debugging-prs-by-running-ci
6. Add labels to the PR as appropriate.

This template is based on the K8s/K8s template:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md
-->

comment.body:
> When nodes are restarted, there are disruption in api server connection and during this time, two leaders are present simultaneously and two local endpoints are created. Later one of them yields as it is not able to get the gateway lock.
> 

Are you saying that there are 2 local endpoints present in the cluster at the same time? When the gateway acquires the leader lock, it first deletes any other endpoints before creating its own. Also it doesn't delete its endpoint if it loses the leader lock and/or exits. I'm trying to see a scenario where 2 local endpoints coexist simultaneously. I think we need to understand this.

If the API server isn't available then it shouldn't be able to acquire the leader lock nor create endpoints as those operations require access to the API server.

What could happen is if the first gateway acquires the lock and creates an endpoint then later loses connection to the API server and can't renew the lock after 5 sec (RenewDeadline`) and exits. Then the second gateway acquires the lock after 10 sec (`LeaseDuration`) and creates another endpoint. But this is a fail-over scenario, ie there's aren't 2 leaders present simultaneously.

commits.message:
Fix new linting errors

Newer versions of goconst detect more instances of string duplication so
introduce constants.

Also fixed :

"indent-error-flow: if block ends with a return statement, so drop this else
and outdent its block (move short variable declaration to its own line if
necessary) (revive)"

Signed-off-by: Tom Pantelis <tompantelis@gmail.com>

Fix lint error in wireguard

pkg/cable/wireguard/getconnections.go:66:57: directive `//nolint:gosec // ...`
  is unused for linter "gosec" (nolintlint)
    if k, err := keyFromSpec(&con.Endpoint); err == nil { //nolint:gosec...

Signed-off-by: Tom Pantelis <tompantelis@gmail.com>

Merge branch 'devel' into rem_rel_notes

Signed-off-by: Sridhar Gaddam <sgaddam@redhat.com>

issue.title: Fix race condtion when mutliple local endpoints are created
issue.body:
There is a race condition when the worker nodes get restarted one by one. More than one submariner endpoint is created in one cluster as two gateways tries to be the leader. One yields later and this triggers a endpoint delete event. This causes routes to be cleared in both local and remote cluster. Later an endpoint update even comes for the active gateway, and we are using the update event in the fix

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our developer guide: https://submariner.io/development/
2. Ensure you have added the appropriate tests for your PR: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#test-new-functionality
3. Read the code review guide to ease the review process: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/
4. If the PR is unfinished, mark it as a draft: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#mark-work-in-progress-prs-as-drafts
5. If you are using CI to debug, use your private fork: https://submariner.io/development/code-review/#use-private-forks-for-debugging-prs-by-running-ci
6. Add labels to the PR as appropriate.

This template is based on the K8s/K8s template:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md
-->

comment.body:
> > More than one submariner endpoint is created in one cluster as two gateways tries to be the leader. One yields later and this triggers a endpoint delete event.
> 
> Can you explain this in more detail? Have you observed a scenario where 2 gateways are simultaneously the leader?
> 
> Whatever the exact scenario/sequence, I wonder if #2763 might alleviate it.

When nodes are restarted, there are disruption in api server connection and during this time,  two leaders are present simultaneously and two local endpoints are created. Later one of them yields as it is not able to get the gateway lock.

I think https://github.com/submariner-io/submariner/pull/2763 will not fix it. @sridhargaddam  any thoughts?

pull_request.title: Delete Calico IPPools when Submariner uninstalled
pull_request.body:
All Calico IPPools created by Submariner should be deleted when Submariner is uninstalled.

This PR updates Calico IPPools handler Uninstall function to delete all IPPools regardless of isGateway field status.

Fixes: https://github.com/submariner-io/submariner/issues/2764

repo.description: Connect all your Kubernetes clusters, no matter where they are in the world.

repo.name: submariner
repo.description: Networking component for interconnecting Pods and Services across Kubernetes clusters.

comment.body: As discussed over slack, the TransitionToGateway would be fired during regular Gateway migrations which would update the isGateway status to True. However, during Uninstall,  an all-together new uninstall Pod would be created and this will not be aware of the Gateway status. Good catch Yossi.

pull_request.title: Delete Calico IPPools when Submariner uninstalled
pull_request.body:
All Calico IPPools created by Submariner should be deleted when Submariner is uninstalled.

This PR updates Calico IPPools handler Uninstall function to delete all IPPools regardless of isGateway field status.

Fixes: https://github.com/submariner-io/submariner/issues/2764

comment.body:
>The Calico IPPool handler in route-agent uses the same handler framework as used by the other handlers, so ideally it should be notified of TransitionToGateway event

Q: Do you expect that Calico handler (or any other handlers) should be notified of TransitionToGateway event even for RA Uninstall DaemonSet ?

issue.title: Fix lint error in wireguard

labels.name: ready-to-test
labels.description: When a PR is ready for full E2E testing

issue.body:
```
pkg/cable/wireguard/getconnections.go:66:57: directive `//nolint:gosec // ...`
  is unused for linter "gosec" (nolintlint)
    if k, err := keyFromSpec(&con.Endpoint); err == nil { //nolint:gosec...
```

commits.message:
Fix lint error in wireguard

pkg/cable/wireguard/getconnections.go:66:57: directive `//nolint:gosec // ...`
  is unused for linter "gosec" (nolintlint)
    if k, err := keyFromSpec(&con.Endpoint); err == nil { //nolint:gosec...

Signed-off-by: Tom Pantelis <tompantelis@gmail.com>
